item.title: DaNette add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "All shall be done, but it may be harder than you think." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: DaNette add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Oh, Adamâ€™s sons, how cleverly you defend yourselves against all that might do you good!" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Kate DiCamillo
item.description: "You can't always judge people by the things they done. You got to judge them by what they are doing now." -- Kate DiCamillo

item.title: DaNette add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Do not dare not to dare." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Kate DiCamillo
item.description: "We appreciate the complicated and wonderful gifts you give us in each other. And we appreciate the task you put down before us, of loving each other the best we can, even as you love us." -- Kate DiCamillo

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Sharon Creech
item.description: "...but it doesn't feel crazy to us. It feels like what we do." -- Sharon Creech

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Sharon Creech from "Walk Two Moons"
item.description: "In the course of a lifetime, waht does it matter?" -- Sharon Creech from "Walk Two Moons"

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "What do I believe that I deserve in this life?" -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "In a world of disorder and disaster and fraud, sometimes only beauty can be trusted. Only artistic excellence is incorruptible. Pleasure cannot be bargained down. And sometimes the meal is the only currency that is real." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "You were given life; it is your duty (and also your entitlement as a human being) to find something beautiful within life, no matter how slight." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "eventually, everything goes away." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Happiness is the consequence of personal effort. You fight for it, strive for it, insist upon it, and sometimes even travel around the world looking for it. You have to participate relentlessly in the manifestations of your own blessings. And once you have achieved a state of happiness, you must never become lax about maintaining it. You must make a mighty effort to keep swimming upward into that happiness forever, to stay afloat on top of it." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Daphne Du Maurier
item.description: "Happiness is not a possession to be prized, it is a quality of thought, a state of mind." -- Daphne Du Maurier

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Dean Hughes
item.description: "If we believe in them, love them and trust them, they see who they are through our eyes." -- Dean Hughes

item.title: DaNette add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If we find ourselves with a desire that nothing in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that we were made for another world." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Martha Beck
item.description: "The end goal of all of this striving is to live joyfully, and that there are often more direct ways of achieving this than conforming to rigid standards set by social custom." -- Martha Beck

item.title: DaNette add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "They could lay bare in the utmost detail everything that you had done or said or thought; but the inner heart, whose workings were mysterious even to yourself, remained impregnable." -- George Orwell

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "...does that not tell you that grief is like life and that there is always somethings unknown beyond it?" -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Alexandre Dumas, The Count of Monte Cristco
item.description: "there is neither happiness nor misfortune in this world, there is merely the comparison between one state and another, nothing more. Only someone who has suffered the deepest misfortune is capable of experiencing the heights of felicity." -- Alexandre Dumas, The Count of Monte Cristco

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "God is full of mercy for everyone, as He has been towards you. He is a father before He is a judge." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Alexandre Dumas, The Count of Monte Cristo
item.description: "Misfortune is needed to plumb certain mysterious depths in the understanding of men." -- Alexandre Dumas, The Count of Monte Cristo

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Public opinion is a weak tyrant compared with our own private opinion. what a man thinks of himself, that it is which determines, or rather indicates, his fate." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "In the long run, men hit only what they aim at. Therefore, they had better aim at something high." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "That which does not kill us makes us stronger." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Ann Howard Creel
item.description: "Memories are fragile things to hold, but many times, it's what we have." -- Ann Howard Creel

item.title: DaNette add a quote by M.L. Forman
item.description: "Doubts can hold you back when need calls." -- M.L. Forman

item.title: DaNette add a quote by M.L. Forman
item.description: "Remember-doubts may check pride, but too much doubt will keep you from doing what must be done." -- M.L. Forman

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Elizabeth Berg
item.description: "We live but a short time, at the longest. How do we make our lives mean something? If we die in glory, with our minds and our hearts fixed on achieving a great goal, we have lived a life that mattered." -- Elizabeth Berg

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Brandon Mull
item.description: "We all posses different gifts and abilities. How we use those gifts determines who we are." -- Brandon Mull

item.title: DaNette add a quote by Jeanne DuPrau from City of Ember
item.description: "What you get is what you get. What you do with what you get, though...that's more the point, wouldn't you say?" -- Jeanne DuPrau from City of Ember
